meanings.definition: The act or process of stocking or storing goods.
meanings.sent1: The stockage of fresh vegetables in the pantry helps keep them fresh.
meanings.sent2: The stockage of books in the library ensures easy access for readers.
meanings.sent3: After the big sale, the stockage of discounted items made the customers very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a well-organized stockage, storing memories neatly in different sections.
meanings.sent5: The stockage of emergency supplies in the shelter saved lives during the storm.

meanings.definition: The amount of goods or materials in stock.
meanings.sent1: The stockage of toys in the store was running low before the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The stockage of flour in the bakery was enough to last for a month.
meanings.sent3: The stockage of candy in the jar tempted everyone passing by.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the empty stockage of the warehouse.
meanings.sent5: The stockage of colorful balloons brightened up the party.

meanings.definition: The practice of keeping a supply of goods for sale.
meanings.sent1: The stockage of fresh flowers in the shop attracted many customers.
meanings.sent2: The stockage of new products in the store shelves excited the shoppers.
meanings.sent3: The stockage of ice cream in winter seemed like a strange choice.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the best advertisement for the stockage of handmade jewelry.
meanings.sent5: The stockage of seasonal fruits added a burst of color to the market.
